text: Is it possible to edit the HubSpot search module so I can search by blog and tags or categories?

Hi Michael, thank you for your quick reply. We've seen this documentation but we're not calling the endpoints in this way. Instead, we're using the Node JS client package. <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-nodejs>. I looked through the reference for this package and was unable to find the section that deals with retrieving sensitive documents.
you can change the theme code
can any one know how to remove ...ail-disclaimers?hsLang=en  hslang slug

I frequently convert module alignment field values into flexbox properties. I am embarrassed to say how many times I did it manually without writing a macro. So today was the day I created macros and shared them. :mrburns:<https://bootstrapcreative.com/HubSpot-module-code-snippet-convert-text-align-to-flex-justify-content-hubl-macro/>

that’s cool. I recently started messing with macros as well.

As an idea for your suggestions, instead of doing all the if/else statements for e.g. the text positioning, couldn’t you just have made a choice field with Label “Left” and value = flex-start and so on? Then make sure to set a default.

Then you could skip the first 8 lines of code and just do:

```justify-content:{{ alignment }};```

Thanks for sharing <@UG7S8J18D>!

<@U03MU3H35R6> that's possible. Doing it myself from time to time. The great thing about <@UG7S8J18D> macro is, that it utilizes the alignment fields which have some benefits in terms of UX
Aha, ok. Well we usually handle spacings on behalf on the clients, but i’ll have to dig into the aligment fields too

Thoughts? Tips? Much appreciated!!

You can just create a form based on custom object properties No?

You dont need to have contact/company properties in there.

I got a from where it just creates a custom object if no contact email is filled out. :raised_hands:

I did create the custom object, and the custom fields - just did a test and it didn't actually update the record I already had in the system. I'm trying to figure out how to make the direct connection from the form > custom object. that's where I'm getting lost
Invitation sent

oh you mean deduplicate thats a different story

you can maybe try like the object name or try to have a unique value property always in the form?
Maybe they will deduplicate it?

if this doesnt do it then you will prob have to either code something to deduplicate before the form output has happened

or deduplicate the custom object after its created with a merge workflow.

Hello everyone,

i tried to work with a sandbox from <http://app-eu1.HubSpot.com|app-eu1.HubSpot.com>.
I need to open my firewall policy like that:
<http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com>'s sandbox => my firewall => my intern api.

My question is: do you have any infos about which FQDN or wildcard i can use ?
I'll not open like ALL => My intern API :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

ty for infomations !

PS: i tried *.<http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com> & *.<http://hubapi.com|hubapi.com> but it doesn't work. When i check the request, it comes from something like 143.244.84.0/22 (not everytime).

Hi everyone!
Sorry if my question was already here, but I could not find the answer.
I understand that storing IP addresses in contacts was removed (<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Sunset-IP-addresses-will-be-sunset-from-all-HubSpot-APIs-on-May/m-p/253124>)
I create contacts via the basic API this way: `api_client.crm.contacts.basic_api.create(body: contact_body).` Is it still possible to set attributes like IP country, IP city, etc.? These fields are read-only.
Is it possible to send the IP address in some other way, not store it, but just use it to fill out these attributes?

Hi everyone,

I was searching previous posts to see if any had asked something similar, but is it possible for *HubSpot SMS* to be connected directly to *Auth0 Passwordless login*? My gut is telling me no based on what I researched since HubSpot SMS is not a SMS provider, rather uses Twilio like Auth0 does. But I wanted to confirm just in case I missed a workaround. Thanks!
Hello Shakil, my supervisor is asking for an approximate timeframe of completion, if you are able to give one.  Thank you!

Thank you! <@UJJ239SC9>!
I successfully created a Secret, added the API as a value, and changed the secret name. But I got a new error that I don't understand.
I also see these 2 notifs

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
Is it possible to clone a module in page contents? I have a tab content module that I would like to clone so I don’t have to retype everything manually

1. The 2 warning notifications are because the code is declaring a variable/function input but then never calling that code - it's a code cleanliness warning, but not an issue. In this case, it's because you don't need to do anything with the results
2. Show the screenshot where you added the secret, then add a console.log() statement on line 20 like this: `console.log(contactResult)`
``` HubSpotClient.crm.contacts.basicApi
    .getById(event.object.objectId, [DEDUPE_PROPERTY])
    .then(contactResult => {
console.log(contactResult)
      let dedupePropValue = contactResult.body.properties[DEDUPE_PROPERTY];```

I'd recommend trying to get something like ChatGPT to help explain error messages.
But, the way to read this particular one is essentially: `"Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'properties')"`
That's saying that when the code was trying to run this statement: `let dedupePropValue = contactResult.body.properties[DEDUPE_PROPERTY];`
that instead of finding a JSON object with parameter 'properties', it was 'undefined' (meaning, it wasn't there -

It's like having someone tell you to go to your kitchen cabinet to find 'cup' but there are no cups, so what to do? It doesn't necessarily answer WHY there are no cups (they're all dirty, they all broke, etc).

You're trying to find why it's undefined. It's likely that your secret isn't valid and the API is returning an unauthorized error, so there were no 'properties' returned. You're going to log out the result to try to find more information

HubSpot filemanager is throwing this error in the app:
`*There was an error uploading your file.* The file "xyz" failed to upload.`

I’m trying to upload jpgs and even the cli is not working. It will upload maybe 2 or 3 and then throw `[ERROR] A Error has occurred. Uploading file "path/to/xyz" to "gallery/xyz" failed`

I’ve ruled out cache and browser extensions since it happens in the CLI. Anyone ever experience this?
This message was deleted.
when you hover over the Tab Content, it should have an ellipsis (3 dot) menu that appears, clicking that will reveal an option to clone
